page.title: 16Inverkeithing, the coastline
page.content:
The coastline of this area is one of contrasts, with wide sandy beaches, rocky shores, mudflats and high cliffs, perfect habitat for all kinds of bird and animal life.
There are many coastal paths offering beautiful seaside walks around Inverkeithing and Dalgety Bay.
Old ruins such as gun emplacements are scattered along the coast (as the {railway bridge}and{Rosyth dockyard were prime targets in both the World Wars).
Sandy beaches such as the ones at St Davids Harbour and Port Laing were once perfect 'day-out' spots, but now, sadly, they are severly polluted. A reflection on our times ?
